a.g: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Meditation
Then look at how He (Allah) granted him (the human) capability, discernment, intellect (Aql), and guidance gradually until he reached and became complete, becoming an adolescent then a youth then middle-aged then an elder, either ungrateful (Kafir) or grateful (Shakir), obedient or disobedient, believing or disbelieving, confirming His (Allah's) saying, the Most High: 'Has there come upon the human a period of time when he was not a thing mentioned? Indeed, We created the human from a sperm-drop mixture to test him, and We made him hearing, seeing. Indeed, We guided him to the path, either grateful or ungrateful.' Then look at the gentleness (Lutf) and generosity (Karam), then at the power (Qudrah) and wisdom (Hikmah); the wonders of the Divine Presence (Al-Hadrah Al-Rabbaniyyah) will astonish you. And the wonder of all wonders is from one who sees beautiful calligraphy or a beautiful engraving on a wall and admires it, so he directs all his concern to pondering the engraver and calligrapher, and how he engraved it and wrote it and how he was capable of it, and he continues to magnify him in himself and says: 'How skillful he is, and how perfect his craftsmanship and how excellent his capability!' Then he looks at these wonders in himself and in others, then he neglects his Maker (Sani') and Fashioner (Musawwir), so His greatness does not amaze him, nor does His majesty (Jalal) and wisdom (Hikmah) perplex him. This is a sample of the wonders of your body which cannot be exhaustively enumerated; it is the closest field for your thought and the clearest witness to the greatness of your Creator, and you are heedless of that, preoccupied with your belly and private parts, and you know nothing of yourself except that you hunger so you eat and become full so you sleep, and you desire so you copulate, and you become angry so you fight, and all the beasts share with you in knowing that. Rather, the specific characteristic of the human that is veiled from the beasts is knowing Allah, the Most High, by contemplating the dominion (Mulk) of the heavens and the earth and the wonders of the horizons and the souls (Anfus), for through it the servant (Abd) enters into the company of the near angels (Al-Mala'ikah Al-Muqarrabin) and is resurrected in the company of the prophets (Al-Nabiyyin) and the truthful ones (Al-Siddiqin), brought near to the Presence (Hadrah) of the Lord of the worlds. And this station (Manzilah) is not for the beasts, nor for a human who is satisfied with the desires of the beasts from the world, for he is evil.

a.g: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
[They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
[From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.
There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
[And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Qur'an progressively.
So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Arrangement of Litanies
And it is a noble time, and its nobility and virtue are indicated by Allah the Exalted swearing by it when He said: 'And by the dawn when it breathes' (Quran 81:18), and praising it when He said: 'The Cleaver of the daybreak' (Quran 6:96), and He the Exalted said: 'Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak"' (Quran 113:1), and His manifestation of power in contracting the shadow therein when He the Exalted said: 'Then We drew it in towards Ourselves, a gradual drawing in' (Quran 25:46), and it is the time of contracting the shadow of the night by spreading the light of the sun, and His guiding people to glorification therein by His saying the Exalted: 'So exalt Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning' (Quran 30:17), and by His saying the Exalted: 'So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting' (Quran 50:39), and His saying the Mighty and Majestic: 'And [in part] of the night exalt Him and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied' (Quran 20:130), and His saying the Exalted: 'And remember the name (ism) of your Lord (rabbika) morning (bukratan) and evening (asilan)' (Quran 76:25). As for its arrangement, let him take from the time of his awakening from sleep, so when he awakens, he should begin with the remembrance (dhikr) of Allah the Exalted by saying: 'Praise be to Allah who gave us life after having caused us to die, and to Him is the resurrection,' to the end of the supplications and verses which we mentioned in the supplication of awakening from the Book of Supplications.

But the kingdom is two kingdoms: a kingdom mixed with various pains and accompanied by rapid disappearance, but it is immediate (al-Ê¿Äjila) and it is in this world; and an eternal, permanent kingdom that is not mixed with turbidity nor pain, nor is it cut off by any cutter, but it is deferred (al-Äjila). And the human being was created hasty (Ê¿ajÅ«lan), desiring the immediate (al-Ê¿Äjila). So Satan came and approached him through the medium of haste that is in his nature, and he seduced him with the immediate (al-Ê¿Äjila) and adorned for him the present, and he approached him through the medium of foolishness (al-á¸¥amq) and promised him delusion in the Hereafter, and tempted him with the kingdom of the Hereafter along with the kingdom of this world, as He said: (And the foolish one is he who follows his soul's (Nafs) desires and wishes upon Allah vain hopes). So the deceived one was deluded by his deception and busied himself with seeking the glory and kingdom of this world to the extent of his capability. And the successful one did not cling to the rope of his deception, for he knew the entrances of his cunning, so he turned away from the immediate (al-Ê¿Äjila). Thus He expressed about the deceived ones with His saying, the Exalted: 'No! But you love the immediate (al-Ê¿Äjila) and leave the Hereafter.' And He said, the Exalted: 'Indeed, these love the immediate (al-Ê¿Äjila) and leave behind them a heavy day.' And He said, the Exalted: 'So turn away from him who turns away from Our Remembrance (Dhikr) and desires not except the life of this world. That is their extent of knowledge.' And when the cunning of Satan spread among all creation, Allah sent the angels to the messengers and they revealed to them what had befallen creation from the destruction of the enemy and his seduction. So they busied themselves with calling creation to the true kingdom over the metaphorical kingdom that has no foundation if it is safe, nor any permanence at all. So they called out to them: 'O you who have believed, what is [the matter] with you that, when it is said to you, "Go forth in the way of Allah," you adhere heavily to the earth? Are you satisfied with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But what is the enjoyment of this world in the Hereafter except a little.'
